Northern Illinois University, DeKalb, Illinois

ExperienceSummary.Description: ~~~~~~   is experienced in the management of:  Marketing (Channel Management); and Sales.    ~~~~~~   has 33 years of work experience, with 3 years of management experience, including a mid-level position.
ExperienceSummary.ManagementStory:
Starting on 1/1/1988, the candidate held the following low-level management position for 3 years:
	Title: Senior Art Director | Art Director | Studio Artist (Production Artist) for INTERSTATE BATTERIES
ExperienceSummary.AttentionNeeded: ATTENTION: The candidate appears to have been in management in a past role (Senior Art Director | Art Director | Studio Artist (Production Artist) for INTERSTATE BATTERIES), but was not in management in the most recent role as Freelance and Contract Graphic Designer, Senior Production Artist for Dallas Fort Worth Metroplex, Texas.

JobTitle.Raw: Freelance and Contract Graphic Designer, Senior Production Artist
JobTitle.Normalized: Freelance and Contract Graphic Designer Senior Production Artist

Positions.Description:
Developed and implemented creative solutions by design processes, project management, estimating and print and digital production. Managed and guided all aspects of client relations with prominent organizations such as GameStop, Del Frisco's Restaurant Group, Interstate Batteries, The Spencer Company, Morning Star Tours,
Book & Brain Consulting, APEX MRI Imaging Center, Boy Scouts of America and more.
Selected Accomplishments:
• Book and Brain Consulting: Earned and awarded repeat business over ten years, leading conceptual and production of four 100-page student workbooks, numerous forms, posters, learning aids and manipulatives
• GameStop Corporate: Successfully created a 24-page employee product booklet, collateral, presentation deck, marketing kits, flyers and POS, all for use in a retail environment while contracted onsite
• Boy Scouts of America: Designed multiple projects, spanning onsite production, line illustrations for bicycle assembly and repair workbooks

(through Creative Circle)
Produced creative conceptual design for retail signage, collateral, ads and social graphics for the worldwide installations of the Department of Defense Army & Air Force Exchange Service retail stores, concessionaire malls, quick convenience stores and gas stations.
Selected Accomplishments:
• Elevated and enhanced the Military Star brand by producing over 100 promotions annually as the subject matter brand expert, the Exchange's credit and rewards program within the military community, one of the highest corporate strategic initiatives among the 35,000 Exchange associates. Successfully generated new graphics for  in-store, mall signage and omni-channel support across digital and social media platforms
• Spearheaded graphics for Military Star mobile app launch and support of 225 dedicated program associates
• Optimized business partnerships for The Exchange by creating Military Star promotional files for Sister Services, comprised of the Commissary, Marine, Coast Guard and Navy exchange corporate offices

JobTitle.Raw: Senior Art Director | Art Director | Studio Artist (Production Artist)
JobTitle.Normalized: Senior Art Director Art Director Studio Artist Production Artist
Variations: Art Director | Art Director | Studio Artist (Production Artist)

Positions.Description: Produced more than 125 multi-faceted projects per year for a multi-national company comprising 300 distributors, 1,200 route sales managers, 200,000+ dealers and 200 retail franchisees. Partnered with 75+ internal clients, initiating design solutions and driving brand continuity using promotional materials. Ensured all projects and tasks completed on-time and within budget. Collaborated with designers, copywriters, freelancers, account executives, print production managers, buyers and project managers. Negotiated contracts with vendors. Directed and coordinated location and studio photo shoots in collaboration with photographers.

Associations.Organization: Team Member of the Year Nomination -  • Advertising Team Member of the Month

Achievements: Book and Brain Consulting: Earned and awarded repeat business over ten years, leading conceptual and production of four 100-page student workbooks, numerous forms, posters, learning aids and manipulatives
Art Directors' Club Silver Louie Award for Logo Design • Super Learner - 2015 | 2016
Team Member of the Year Nomination - 2015 • Advertising Team Member of the Month - 2008
Designed and produced signage and event collateral for multiple corporate-sponsored national conventions, retail franchisee conventions, and outside trade shows, including AAPEX and SEMA

Conceptualized and created wide array of collateral for 18 national account managers, coordinators, and marketers such as print, POP, labels, signage, and launch kits to support world-class brands Kia Motors, Hyundai, Suzuki Motorcycle, Land Rover, Volkswagen, Toyota, and others
Lead the creative for 13 in-house B2B clients within the PowerCare business unit, developing original concepts for collateral, labels, POP, trade show signage and booth development
Subject matter expert for two online storefronts to support 200 retail franchisees and 300 legacy distributors. Coached fellow team members in template generation and processes
QualificationsSummary:
CORE COMPETENCIES
Art Direction Expertise	Collateral, Brochures, Flyers	Packaging & Display Design
Adobe Creative Cloud	Strategic Brand Management	Trade Show Graphics
Digital Graphics (web, social, email)	Retail POS, Store Signage	Marketing & Advertising Material
Senior Production Artist	Retail Direct Mail, B2B, B2C	Cross-Functional Collaboration


TECHNICAL SKILLS
Adobe Creative Cloud: InDesign, Photoshop, Illustrator, Acrobat, Bridge; Mac OS, Microsoft Office
Classes in HTML5, CSS3, Dreamweaver, Animate

Findings.Message: Each section type should only appear once in a resume.
A street level address was not found in the contact information. A full contact address should always be included in a resume as it allows for location based searches.
Every degree in a resume should have a name or type associated with it, such as 'B.S.' or 'M.S.'.
High school (or lower) education should not be included on resumes that contain higher-level education.

The following sections were identified as a skills section type: 'CORE COMPETENCIES', 'TECHNICAL SKILLS'. Skills should not be in a separate section, but instead, each skill should be included in the descriptions of work history or education. THIS IS INCREDIBLY IMPORTANT FOR AI MATCHING ALGORITHMS

ResumeMetadata.PlainText:
~~~~~~  
   ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~     |   Keller, Texas   |      ~~~~~~~  
   ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~     |      ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~  

GRAPHIC DESIGNER
Graphic Design & Production   |   Corporate Branding   |   Large Projects & Campaigns

Creative professional with extensive experience in art direction, graphic design and print-ready production. Excels at translating corporate branding needs into effective, dynamic brochures, signage, digital graphics, retail POS and conceptual using project/campaign leadership, astute creativity, business acumen and team collaboration. Broad knowledge of positioning the company for continuous growth through branding, corporate identity, print advertising, digital graphics, production and well-known marketing events.
• Honed creative skills with technical expertise, relationship building and brand management
• Expertise with high-profile clients, tailoring concepts and execution to their unique marketing requirements
• Collaboration and supervision of other creatives, writers, account executives, internal clients and printers

CORE COMPETENCIES
Art Direction Expertise	Collateral, Brochures, Flyers	Packaging & Display Design
Adobe Creative Cloud	Strategic Brand Management	Trade Show Graphics
Digital Graphics (web, social, email)	Retail POS, Store Signage	Marketing & Advertising Material
Senior Production Artist	Retail Direct Mail, B2B, B2C	Cross-Functional Collaboration


PROFESSIONAL EXPERIENCE

   ~~~~~~   GRAPHIC DESIGN - Dallas Fort Worth Metroplex, Texas	1/90 to Present
Freelance and Contract Graphic Designer, Senior Production Artist
Developed and implemented creative solutions by design processes, project management, estimating and print and digital production. Managed and guided all aspects of client relations with prominent organizations such as GameStop, Del Frisco's Restaurant Group, Interstate Batteries, The Spencer Company, Morning Star Tours,
Book & Brain Consulting, APEX MRI Imaging Center, Boy Scouts of America and more.
Selected Accomplishments:
• Book and Brain Consulting: Earned and awarded repeat business over ten years, leading conceptual and production of four 100-page student workbooks, numerous forms, posters, learning aids and manipulatives
• GameStop Corporate: Successfully created a 24-page employee product booklet, collateral, presentation deck, marketing kits, flyers and POS, all for use in a retail environment while contracted onsite
• Boy Scouts of America: Designed multiple projects, spanning onsite production, line illustrations for bicycle assembly and repair workbooks

THE EXCHANGE/AAFES - Dallas, Texas	5/18 to 4/20
Contract Senior Graphic Designer (through Creative Circle)
Produced creative conceptual design for retail signage, collateral, ads and social graphics for the worldwide installations of the Department of Defense Army & Air Force Exchange Service retail stores, concessionaire malls, quick convenience stores and gas stations.
Selected Accomplishments:
• Elevated and enhanced the Military Star brand by producing over 100 promotions annually as the subject matter brand expert, the Exchange's credit and rewards program within the military community, one of the highest corporate strategic initiatives among the 35,000 Exchange associates. Successfully generated new graphics for  in-store, mall signage and omni-channel support across digital and social media platforms
• Spearheaded graphics for Military Star mobile app launch and support of 225 dedicated program associates
• Optimized business partnerships for The Exchange by creating Military Star promotional files for Sister Services, comprised of the Commissary, Marine, Coast Guard and Navy exchange corporate offices

INTERSTATE BATTERIES - Dallas, Texas	1988 to 1990, 1994 to 2016
Senior Art Director | Art Director | Studio Artist (Production Artist)
Produced more than 125 multi-faceted projects per year for a multi-national company comprising 300 distributors, 1,200 route sales managers, 200,000+ dealers and 200 retail franchisees. Partnered with 75+ internal clients, initiating design solutions and driving brand continuity using promotional materials. Ensured all projects and tasks completed on-time and within budget. Collaborated with designers, copywriters, freelancers, account executives, print production managers, buyers and project managers. Negotiated contracts with vendors. Directed and coordinated location and studio photo shoots in collaboration with photographers.
Selected Accomplishments:
• Designed and produced signage and event collateral for multiple corporate-sponsored national conventions, retail franchisee conventions, and outside trade shows, including AAPEX and SEMA
• Conceptualized and created wide array of collateral for 18 national account managers, coordinators, and marketers such as print, POP, labels, signage, and launch kits to support world-class brands Kia Motors, Hyundai, Suzuki Motorcycle, Land Rover, Volkswagen, Toyota, and others
• Lead the creative for 13 in-house B2B clients within the PowerCare business unit, developing original concepts for collateral, labels, POP, trade show signage and booth development
• Subject matter expert for two online storefronts to support 200 retail franchisees and 300 legacy distributors. Coached fellow team members in template generation and processes

ADDITIONAL EXPERIENCE
Graphic Designer | Production Artist, Unigraphics - Dallas, Texas
Graphic Designer | Design Assistant, Designer Stewart & Winner - Louisville, Kentucky
Graphic Designer | Volunteer Training Assistant, Discovery Training - Dallas, Texas

EDUCATION & CREDENTIALS

Northern Illinois University, DeKalb, Illinois

Art Institute Of Chicago, Chicago, Illinois

Team Member of the Year Nomination - 2015 • Advertising Team Member of the Month - 2008
